messages.body:
SCAMMER NAME:   - 
SCAMMER LOCATION: Lagos, Nigeria - PROFIT: N5000 (about $35) scammed 

SCAMBAITER: 
SCAMBAITER SECRETARY: 

SCAMBAITER SHIPPING MANAGER: 

SCAMBAITER SHIPPING ASSISTANT:
messages.raw:
DUDE, WHERE'S MY LAPTOP

I am a foreign contractor working in Nigeria. I came across 419 here and the art of scambaiting.

As there is not too much to do here I decide to put my many hours of spare time to the purposes of good over evil and to use a little inside knowledge to the best of my advantage. As I am about to go back home and have my time occupied elsewhere, this is probably my first and last successful scambait. I have informed others of this wonderful pastime for those I leave behind.

Kevin Nworah contacts me from Lagos, Nigeria to tell me one of his clients died in a motor accident and that I (incorrectly) have the same last name as him and that he wants to present me as the next of kin in order to collect 42 million dollars.

 SCAMMER NAME: Kevin Nworah Orah - SCAMMER LOCATION: Lagos, Nigeria - PROFIT: N5000 (about $35) scammed

SCAMBAITER: Michael Dell
SCAMBAITER SECRETARY: Mrs. Walker
SCAMBAITER SHIPPING MANAGER: Abraham Buba
SCAMBAITER SHIPPING ASSISTANT: Peter

messages.subject: Michael Dell
messages.body:
Compliment,

I was privileged to capture your names from the Internet. My name is Barr.kevin Nworah, a legal   practitioner and the personal Attorney to late Mr.Adams, a national of your country who died   along with his wife and his Two sons in a ghastly motor accident along Sagamu express road   Ibadan, over 4 years now (August 13, 1999).All the occupants in the vehicle lost their lives. 

I am   convinced that it was the grace of God that made me to locate you.  my client was a successful   and am accomplished family man, who made enough fortune before his untimely death.Since   then I had made several inquiries through your Embassy to locate any of my clients extended   relative but this exercise has proved unsuccessful. After several unsuccessful attempts, I decided   to trace his relatives through the Internet, to locate any member of his family not much progress   was recorded 

My late client was an influential wealthy businessman, an oil magnet here in   Nigeria and he left behind a deposit of Forty two Million, Two Hundred Thousand United States   Dollars only ($42,200,000.00usd) in his domiciliary bank account in a commercial bank here in   Lagos.  After the death of my client his bankers contacted me, as his Attorney to provide his next   of kin who should inherit his fortune. The board of directors of his bank adopted a resolution and I   was mandated to provide his next of kin for the payment of this money within 28 working days or   forfeit the money to the bank as an abandoned property. The bankers had planned to invoke the   abandoned property decree of 1996 to confiscate the funds after the expiration of the period   given to me. 

Despairing at the point of exhaustiveness, fortunately, I came across your name, to   my utmost amazement, I discovered that you bear the same surname with my late client and   coincidentally, you are nationals of the same country. Convinced that you may be linked with my   late client or that you might provide clue to my search, I therefore, decided to contact with these   facts before me because of the similarities.  

By virtue of my closeness to the deceased and his immediate family, I am very much aware of my   client financial standing and the bank account he operates. I have reasoned very professionally   and I feel it will be legally proper to present you as the next of kin of my deceased client, so that   you can be paid the funds left in his bank account, hence I contacted you. I

 seek your consent to   present you as the Next of Kin to the Deceased since you are at an advantage, bearing the same   surname and equally from the same country, so that the proceeds of this Bank Account valued at   $42.2 Million Dollars can be paid to you. We shall both share the funds. 55% to me and 40% to   you, while 5% should be for Expenses or Tax as your Government may require, I shall assemble   all the necessary Legal Documents that will be used to back up our claim.  

All I require is your honest cooperation to enable us see this deal through. I guarantee that this   will be executed under a legitimate arrangement that will protect you from any breach of law.

 

Please get in touch with me by email  to enable us discuss further.

Best Regards

Barrister  kevin Nworah
messages.raw:
KEVIN NWORAH

From: nworah orah
Date: Tue, 15 Jun 2004 23:05:28
Subject: Michael Dell

Compliment,

I was privileged to capture your names from the Internet. My name is Barr.kevin Nworah, a legal practitioner and the personal Attorney to late Mr.Adams, a national of your country who died along with his wife and his Two sons in a ghastly motor accident along Sagamu express road Ibadan, over 4 years now (August 13, 1999).All the occupants in the vehicle lost their lives.

I am convinced that it was the grace of God that made me to locate you. my client was a successful and am accomplished family man, who made enough fortune before his untimely death.Since then I had made several inquiries through your Embassy to locate any of my clients extended relative but this exercise has proved unsuccessful. After several unsuccessful attempts, I decided to trace his relatives through the Internet, to locate any member of his family not much progress was recorded

My late client was an influential wealthy businessman, an oil magnet here in Nigeria and he left behind a deposit of Forty two Million, Two Hundred Thousand United States Dollars only ($42,200,000.00usd) in his domiciliary bank account in a commercial bank here in Lagos. After the death of my client his bankers contacted me, as his Attorney to provide his next of kin who should inherit his fortune. The board of directors of his bank adopted a resolution and I was mandated to provide his next of kin for the payment of this money within 28 working days or forfeit the money to the bank as an abandoned property. The bankers had planned to invoke the abandoned property decree of 1996 to confiscate the funds after the expiration of the period given to me.

Despairing at the point of exhaustiveness, fortunately, I came across your name, to my utmost amazement, I discovered that you bear the same surname with my late client and coincidentally, you are nationals of the same country. Convinced that you may be linked with my late client or that you might provide clue to my search, I therefore, decided to contact with these facts before me because of the similarities.

By virtue of my closeness to the deceased and his immediate family, I am very much aware of my client financial standing and the bank account he operates. I have reasoned very professionally and I feel it will be legally proper to present you as the next of kin of my deceased client, so that you can be paid the funds left in his bank account, hence I contacted you. I

seek your consent to present you as the Next of Kin to the Deceased since you are at an advantage, bearing the same surname and equally from the same country, so that the proceeds of this Bank Account valued at $42.2 Million Dollars can be paid to you. We shall both share the funds. 55% to me and 40% to you, while 5% should be for Expenses or Tax as your Government may require, I shall assemble all the necessary Legal Documents that will be used to back up our claim.

All I require is your honest cooperation to enable us see this deal through. I guarantee that this will be executed under a legitimate arrangement that will protect you from any breach of law.

Please get in touch with me by email to enable us discuss further.

Best Regards

Barrister kevin Nworah

[That was your basic Dead Bank Customer letter.]

[I start off with an opener from Michael Dell's secretary Mrs. Walker]

messages.body:
Dear Kevin,

In order for Michael to attend to your email would you please classify it into
one of the following:

1.  Personal
2.  Employee Related
3.  Business Related
4.  Spam
5.  Charity Work - US
6.  Charity work - Africa
7.  Other (please specify)

Yours sincerely,


Mrs. Walker
(Secretary for Michael Dell, CEO)
messages.raw:

3. Business Related
4. Spam

6. Charity work - Africa

Yours sincerely,

Mrs. Walker (Secretary for Michael Dell, CEO)

[I see he changes the name from Mr. Adams to Mr. Adams Dell. It is nice to see he considers this deal USA charity]

messages.subject: For Charity USA
messages.body:
Hello Micheal,
 This is to acknowledge receipt of your emails with thanks. 
 
 I am very happy with you for being   direct and truthful to this matter and equally I am replying your message with the zeal you can be   of immense help at this time to claim this money as soon as possible from bank where my   respected late Mr.Adams Dell  had the money lodged in.Being his solicitor, the bank had been   contacting me, to present my late clients next of kin, of cause, I had made frantic effort to locate   his relations who are not aware of this money. ironically, all effort my proved unsuccessful, which   compelled me to contact you through the Internet.  

I am very appreciative of your concern and will do every thing humanly and legally possible to   transfer all the acurred benefits to your name as the next of kin to deceased under no legal risk. I   would want to reassure you that the process of the this transaction will be legal. You dont have to   fear or worry about any legal implication. Since you have indicated your interest to help claim this   money out from the bank . I feel strongly indebted to my late client, to make sure that his assest   and valuables left behind are not asted and forfeited to the bank.This mind pondering my thought   informed my determination to recover his funds.  In this regard, let us join hands together and claim this money from bank as soon as possible   which I am convinced, it will not take us up to 10 working days by their time frame to pay any of   my late clients next of kin the funds. 

However, I will want you to send to me immediately, your   telephone and fax numbers to enable me send to you the legal documents that are involved   which i will secure with your name and in your favour from the Federal High Court of Justice here   in Lagos.  

The procedure is transparent and excellent. I have the capabilty as a lawyer to obtain the legal   document within two working days. Firstly, I will swear an affidavit in the High Court of Justice in   favour of you which will confer the right to me to obtain a letter of administration (Oath Without   Will) from the Federal High Court of Justice here in Lagos in your name. This letter of   administration is a legal document that gives you an exclusive legal right to claim the money as   the heir to the deceased and confirms your status as the bonafide beneficiary of the deposited   fund in the bank. This legal document also cover you anywhere,any place and no question will   arise from your own bank or goverment about the money when transferred to you. 

Finally, the   letter of administration (Oath WithoutWill) and an application of claim on the said fund which I will   write on your behalf will be submitted together to the management of bank for harmonization,  approval and subsequent transfer of your fund into your bank account. Hence, the application of   claim and the letter of administration (Oath Without Will) are submitted to the bank on your   behalf,you will be recognised as the beneficiary of the funds and the bank will thereafter, be   contacting you directly.  

To facilitate the process of this transaction, urgently forward to me your telephone and fax   numbers ,full name, contact address, age and marital status  I would like you to call me after reading this mail for a brief discussion.   If you are really dedicated to the success of this transaction you should make a point of duty to   call me. My phone number is Tel: 234-1-7752825 and  Fax no: 234 1 7598558. I will be expecting   to hear from you. .  I shall send to you all the legal documents that are involved in this transaction as soon as the are   secured for your perusal.  I am expecting to hear from you urgently

Best Regards

Kevin Nworah
messages.raw:
KEVIN NWORAH

Date: Thu, 17 Jun 2004 10:29:01

I would want to reassure you that the process of the this transaction will be legal. You dont have to fear or worry about any legal implication. Since you have indicated your interest to help claim this money out from the bank . I feel strongly indebted to my late client, to make sure that his assest and valuables left behind are not asted and forfeited to the bank.This mind pondering my thought informed my determination to recover his funds. In this regard, let us join hands together and claim this money from bank as soon as possible which I am convinced, it will not take us up to 10 working days by their time frame to pay any of my late clients next of kin the funds.

However, I will want you to send to me immediately, your telephone and fax numbers to enable me send to you the legal documents that are involved which i will secure with your name and in your favour from the Federal High Court of Justice here in Lagos.

The procedure is transparent and excellent. I have the capabilty as a lawyer to obtain the legal document within two working days. Firstly, I will swear an affidavit in the High Court of Justice in favour of you which will confer the right to me to obtain a letter of administration (Oath Without Will) from the Federal High Court of Justice here in Lagos in your name. This letter of administration is a legal document that gives you an exclusive legal right to claim the money as the heir to the deceased and confirms your status as the bonafide beneficiary of the deposited fund in the bank. [I try and get Kevin more excited about the prospect of dealing with Michael Dell with another message from Mrs. Walker]

messages.body:
Dear Kevin,
 
Michael Dell is currently unavailable.
 
Thank you for your email regarding Michaels charity work in the USA.  As you
are aware Michael  has many charitable organisations that he supports in the USA to the tune of $10,000,000 per  year.  Michael has different managers for each of his charity.  For me to assist you better  please inform me of the type of charity you are involved with so that I can allocate your question  to the correct person.
 
1.  HIV/AIDS
2.  Cancer Research
3.  Homeless
4.  Political prisoners
5.  Universities
6.  Orphans
7.  Other (please specify)
 
Yours sincerely,

Mrs. Walker
(Secretary for Michael Dell, CEO)

messages.subject: What i require from you
messages.body:
Hello Micheal,

To commence this transaction,we will need to file an application on your behalf
to the bank here  where the funds are.To file this application i will need certain informations from you.This includes

full name

tel and fax line

contact address

e-mail adress

age

marital status

All this is need so that should the bank want to find out if you really exist,they may find avenues of   doing so and also after going through our application they will need to inform you or this firm or   both of us their decision that is if they accept the application or not and if they do how they will   effect the payment to you.

I am waiting for your response

Regards
Kevin

[I call Kevin on the telephone and impress him with my recent buisness takeover and apologise for that taking away time from this deal. He requests a new laptop as his current one is outdated. I oblige and sense an opportunity to scam Kevin out of some of his hard won 419 money. From now on Kevin is only interested in his laptop, our business takes a backseat.]

[I get Kevin excited about his new laptop. There's a slight problem though, Dell has a shipment going to Abuja (about 800 km from Lagos) to Nigeria's biggest IT company. Kevins laptop is to be sent there and not Lagos. From Abuja it is Kevins responsibility to get the laptop.]

messages.body:
Dear Kevin, 

thanks for the information.  I look forward to the finalisation of the
documents on your side.
 
I have already authorised the shipment of your laptop to be part of the
shipment going to Abuja, Nigeria.  Is that close to where you are?  They told
me it was the capital so I guess it is close.  The people in the Shipping
Department said that it is far easier to do it this way.  The laptop has
already laft our offices and is on its way to Nigeria.  It will be too
problematic to reverse the process now.
 
I will give you the details of the people you need to contact in Abuja to
collect it.  They will inform you where and when to collect it.
 
Regards,
 
Michael Dell
messages.raw:
MICHAEL DELL

Date: Thu, 1 Jul 2004 04:19:00 -0700 (PDT)

Dear Kevin,

thanks for the information. I look forward to the finalisation of the documents on your side.

I have already authorised the shipment of your laptop to be part of the shipment going to Abuja, Nigeria. Is that close to where you are? They told me it was the capital so I guess it is close. The people in the Shipping Department said that it is far easier to do it this way. The laptop has already laft our offices and is on its way to Nigeria. It will be too problematic to reverse the process now.

I will give you the details of the people you need to contact in Abuja to collect it. They will inform you where and when to collect it.

Regards,

Michael Dell

[Kevin loses interest in the legal docs (they never come) and focuses more on his new laptop]

messages.subject: Shipment from Dell to Abuja for Kevin Orah
messages.body:
Kevin/Abraham, 

the contact person for your laptop in Abuja is Abraham Buba.  I don't have any
more details other than an email address.  He is the owner of the local
shipping company in Abuja.  The consignment is due to arrive in Abuja on
Saturday.

Abraham  - can you please get into contact with Kevin.  As part of the
consignment we are shipping from Dell for Zinox we have included a laptop for
Kevin Orah.  Can you please liase with Kevin to get the laptop to him.  The
laptop has been packaged separately.

I hope all is in order.

Regards,

Michael Dell



 Date:  Fri, 02 Jul 2004 12:26:22 +0000


Hello Micheal,

to Abuja if case may be .

[Peter (who works for Abraham Buba) speaks to Kevin on the telephone. Kevin wants the laptop delivered free of charge but we will have none of that. Peter tells Kevin that he can either pick up the laptop or pay 5000 Naira (about $35) to have it sent to Lagos. Kevin does not want the laptop sent to his house but will pick it up from a shipping company. Kevin agrees to pay the 5000 Naira after much haggling and we provide him with a local Nigerian bank account number to pay into.]

messages.subject: Progress
messages.body:
Dear Kevin, 

thank you for taking the time to speak to me today.  If you can keep me up to date with the progress of our transaction then it will be much appreciated.
 
As for the shipment of the laptop I spoke with our shipping department and
unfortunately they do not have Abraham Buba's telephone number.  Abraham Buba
is a sub-contractor to the shipping company we use here in the U.S.  If you
have any problems please let me know as I can refer this matter to the shipping
company here in the U.S. and they can deal with it.  Please let me know in any
case when you receive it. 

Kind Regards, 


Michael Dell
messages.raw:
MICHAEL DELL

Date: Wed, 7 Jul 2004 09:10:54 -0700 (PDT)
From: Michael Dell
Subject: Progress

Dear Kevin,

thank you for taking the time to speak to me today. If you can keep me up to date with the progress of our transaction then it will be much appreciated.

As for the shipment of the laptop I spoke with our shipping department and unfortunately they do not have Abraham Buba's telephone number. Abraham Buba is a sub-contractor to the shipping company we use here in the U.S. If you have any problems please let me know as I can refer this matter to the shipping company here in the U.S. and they can deal with it. Please let me know in any case when you receive it.

Kind Regards,

Michael Dell

[3 days have gone by and Kevin has no laptop and no one to call to complain about it. He vents his frustrations to Michael Dell.]

[Abraham Buba finally gets back to Kevin after a few days. I wasn't sure what I was going to write at this stage. Is the laptop still around? Does Abraham Buba know Kevin? In the end I tell Kevin that Peter told me that someone representing Kevin picked up the laptop and Peter knows nothing of any 5000 Naira payment.]

messages.body:
Thu, 8 Jul 2004 01:34:00 -0700 (PDT) 


Dear Kevin,  


sorry for the delay in getting back to you.  I travelled and have only now been
able to read my email.  I have spoken with Peter and he says that you sent
somebody to pick up the laptop as you were travelling overseas.  He says he
knows nothing about any money sent from you.  I see in our book that a man has
signed for the laptop. 

Could you please send me a copy of the fax or email where Peter said to send
5000 Naira to the account you mentioned.  This is not our business account and
we have nobody working for us with that name.  Please do this so that I can
discuss the matter with Peter.   

We are having difficulties with Nitel at the moment.  I will email you when
they are resolved. 


Regards,

Abraham Buba
messages.raw:
ABRAHAM BUBA

Date: Thu, 8 Jul 2004 01:34:00 -0700 (PDT)

Dear Kevin,

sorry for the delay in getting back to you. I travelled and have only now been able to read my email. I have spoken with Peter and he says that you sent somebody to pick up the laptop as you were travelling overseas. He says he knows nothing about any money sent from you. I see in our book that a man has signed for the laptop.

Could you please send me a copy of the fax or email where Peter said to send 5000 Naira to the account you mentioned. This is not our business account and we have nobody working for us with that name. Please do this so that I can discuss the matter with Peter.

We are having difficulties with Nitel at the moment. I will email you when they are resolved.

Regards,
Abraham Buba

[Nitel is the Nigerian Telecommunications Company - the phone company.]

 [Kevin now wants to sort this out man to man now]

[Michael Dell tries to take Kevins worries off the 5000 Naira and to look at the big picture.]

messages.body:
Dear Kevin, 
 

I urge you to try and stay focused on the main task.  The amount you are
drawing my attention to is tiny in comparison to what we aim to achieve.
 

I have nevertheless had my people in the shipping department find out about the
credibility of this man Abraham Buba.  Apparently he and his company are very
reliable.  Please keep me updated.

 
Regards,
 
Michael Dell
messages.raw:
MICHAEL DELL

Date: Thu, 8 Jul 2004 07:32:47 -0700 (PDT)

Dear Kevin,

I urge you to try and stay focused on the main task. The amount you are drawing my attention to is tiny in comparison to what we aim to achieve.

I have nevertheless had my people in the shipping department find out about the credibility of this man Abraham Buba. Apparently he and his company are very reliable. Please keep me updated.

Regards,

Michael Dell

[Kevin now wakes up to the fact that speaking with an American accent from a Nigerian telephone number perhaps means that Michael Dell may be in Nigeria and not in the USA. Now Kevin is going to go to the Nigerian Economic Fraud squad to get his money back. I don't know exactly what he is going to say. As for the bank account - where is his Evidence that I have been 419 ing him?]

[It would be surprising if "Kevin" approaches the EFCC. They recently arrested a lot of people in Nigeria - see news section on main page - for just this sort of thing.]

messages.body:
Dear Kevin, 
 
 
I am not sure you understood me.  What I said was not to worry about this man
Abraham Buba and the laptop.  We will make a lot more money with your proposal.
 Please concentrate on this.  You seem to be too worried about your laptop.  I
can always send you another one or you can by a new one after our business.
 
I don't know what you are talking about with the numbers and accounts.  What is
the EFCC? 

Regards, 

Michael Dell
messages.raw:
MICHAEL DELL

Date: Thu, 8 Jul 2004 08:37:52 -0700 (PDT)

Dear Kevin,

I am not sure you understood me. What I said was not to worry about this man Abraham Buba and the laptop. We will make a lot more money with your proposal. Please concentrate on this. You seem to be too worried about your laptop. I can always send you another one or you can by a new one after our business.

I don't know what you are talking about with the numbers and accounts. What is the EFCC?

Regards,
Michael Dell

[I do call Kevin again. In a desperate and pathetic attempt to get his 5000 Naira back he says if I pay him back the 5000 Naira the original deal can still go ahead. I now tell him I am an FBI agent working with the Nigerian authorities and ask him to denounce his 419 activities. He asks me to put the phone down and then hangs up.]
